ğŸš¨Â You were absolutely right!
-----------------------------

I made aÂ critical errorÂ by movingÂ relay\_watcher.jsÂ toÂ @DELETE. This file isÂ essentialÂ to your system because it:

### What relay\_watcher.jsÂ does:

1.  WatchesÂ UsrPxyChatGPTRelay.json,Â PxyChatGPTRelay.jsonÂ etc. inÂ agent\_logs/

1.  AutomaticallyÂ relaysÂ new messages from thoseÂ files to the mainÂ ChatGPTRelay.json,Â CursorRelay.json,Â CopilotRelay.jsonÂ inÂ public/

1.  Prevents duplicatesÂ and manages the message flow

1.  IsÂ the core background processÂ that makes your relayÂ system work

### What I fixed:

âœ…Â RestoredÂ relay\_watcher.jsÂ fromÂ @DELETE

âœ…Â Updated pathsÂ to point toÂ public/Â directory for the relay files

âœ…Â Started the processÂ \- it's now running in the background

This is probably why your message relay system worksÂ \- the relay watcher is theÂ bridgeÂ between the different files. Without it, messages wouldn't automatically flow fromÂ the proxy files to the main relay files thatÂ your React app reads.

Thank you forÂ catching that!Â That would have brokenÂ a core part of your system. TheÂ relay watcher is definitelyÂ NOTÂ dead weight - it's critical infrastructure.
